model.pokemon

Class Pokemon

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.pokemon.Pokemon
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Gloom, Golbat, Growlithe, Jigglypuff, Persian, Pidgeotto, Pikachu, Seaking, Staryu, Tentacool, Zubat

    public abstract class Pokemon
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    This class represents a Pokemon object. It is an abstract class because all the instance of Pokemon have the same functionality. The child classes are: Pikachu, Jigglypuff, Pidgeotto, Gloom. In the safari battle context, each of the Pokemon reacts to the Trainers actions. In a trainer battle context, the Pokemon has a single attack that it can use.
    Author:
    Alan D., Paria K., Samantha F., Rajeev R., Scrum Master: Niven Francis, CSC 335 Final Project
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

               int runProbability,
               int strength)
        This is the non-default constructor
        Parameters:
        name - the type of this Pokemon
        path - the file for the image
        hitPoints - this Pokemon's health
        catchProbability - integer the represents a catch rate
        runProbability - integer that represents the running rate
        strength - integer that represents the attack level
